Class WeaponComponent

java.lang.Object
com.almasb.fxgl.entity.component.Component
com.arena.dual_arena.components.WeaponComponent
public class WeaponComponent extends com.almasb.fxgl.entity.component.Component
Component for handling weapon-specific interactions and behaviors in the game. This component manages weapon positioning, firing, and interactions with the game's control inputs.

  • Property Summary

    Properties inherited from class com.almasb.fxgl.entity.component.Component

  • Constructor Details

    • WeaponComponent

      public WeaponComponent(Weapon weapon, javafx.geometry.Point2D barrelOffset)
      Constructs a WeaponComponent with a specific weapon and its barrel offset. This setup is essential for managing how the weapon interacts within the game world, including where projectiles originate.
      Parameters:
      weapon - The weapon instance that this component will manage.
      barrelOffset - The offset from the center of the weapon to the point where projectiles are considered to begin.

  • Method Details

    • onAdded

      public void onAdded()
      Called when the component is added to an entity. Initializes debugging visuals if debug mode is active. Debug visuals include a red circle at the weapon's origin to track its position clearly.
      Overrides:
      onAdded in class com.almasb.fxgl.entity.component.Component

    • onUpdate

      public void onUpdate(double tpf)
      Called every frame, updating the state of the weapon component. If the weapon is picked up by an owner, it updates the weapon's position to align with the owner and handles rotation based on the current control input (either mouse or controller).
      Overrides:
      onUpdate in class com.almasb.fxgl.entity.component.Component
      Parameters:
      tpf - Time per frame, provided by the game engine, used for frame-rate-independent updates.

    • rotateWithController

      public void rotateWithController()
      Rotates the weapon based on controller input to align with the direction pointed by the game controller's right stick. This method considers a dead zone to prevent weapon rotation due to minimal stick displacements.

    • getBarrelPosition

      public javafx.geometry.Point2D getBarrelPosition()
      Calculates the actual barrel position of the weapon, considering the current rotation. This position is where projectiles will originate from when the weapon fires.
      Returns:
      The calculated barrel position as a Point2D.

    • pickup

      public void pickup(com.almasb.fxgl.entity.Entity newOwner)
      Assigns a new owner to the weapon, marking it as picked up. This changes the weapon's state to "in use," allowing it to interact with other game mechanics like firing.
      Parameters:
      newOwner - The entity that is picking up the weapon.

    • drop

      public void drop()
      Releases the weapon from its current owner, resetting its state and position. This method is called when the weapon is dropped by the player, resetting its orientation and ready state.

    • primaryFire

      public void primaryFire(javafx.geometry.Point2D direction)
      Initiates firing the weapon's primary projectile if the weapon is currently picked up and ready to fire. This method checks the weapon's cooldown and fires a projectile if enough time has elapsed since the last shot.
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction in which to fire the projectile, typically towards a target or cursor position.

    • secondaryFire

      public void secondaryFire(javafx.geometry.Point2D direction)
      Initiates firing the weapon's secondary projectile if the weapon is currently picked up and ready to fire. This method checks the weapon's cooldown for secondary fire and fires a projectile if enough time has elapsed since the last secondary shot.
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction in which to fire the secondary projectile.

    • isPickedUp

      public boolean isPickedUp()
      Checks if the weapon is currently picked up by an owner.
      Returns:
      True if the weapon is picked up, false otherwise.

    • getOwner

      public com.almasb.fxgl.entity.Entity getOwner()
      Gets the entity that currently owns the weapon. This could be a player or any other entity that can wield weapons.
      Returns:
      The owner entity of the weapon, or null if it is not currently owned.

    • getWeapon

      public Weapon getWeapon()
      Retrieves the weapon data associated with this component, which includes its firing mechanics, rates, and projectile types.
      Returns:
      The weapon instance being managed by this component.
